item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，美国和俄罗斯正在探索恢复俄罗斯天然气流向欧洲的途径
item.description: 八位熟悉会谈情况的消息人士告诉路透社，随着欧洲与俄罗斯能源关系的霜冻，华盛顿和莫斯科的官员就美国帮助恢复俄罗斯对欧洲大陆的天然气销售进行了讨论。【原文：With a frost covering Europe's energy relations with Russia, officials from Washington and Moscow have held discussions about the U.S. helping to revive Russian gas sales to the continent, eight sources familiar with the talks have told Reuters.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：Coinbase 将以 29 亿美元收购 Deribit
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引公司高管的话报道，最大的上市加密货币交易所 Coinbase 将以 29 亿美元的现金和股票收购 Deribit。【原文：Coinbase , the largest publicly traded cryptocurrency exchange, will acquire Deribit for $2.9 billion in cash and stock, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing company executives.】

item.title: 美国第一季度工人生产率下降
item.description: 第一季度美国工人的生产率出现了近三年来的首次下降，导致劳动力成本激增，在企业面临关税带来的成本上升之际，这可能会挤压企业的利润空间。【原文：U.S. worker productivity dropped in the first quarter for the first time in nearly three years, resulting in a surge in labor costs that could squeeze margins for businesses at a time when they are facing rising costs from tariffs.】

item.title: 莱茵金属与 ICEYE 达成制造军用卫星的初步协议
item.description: 德国莱茵金属公司（Rheinmetall）已同意与芬兰 ICEYE 公司组建一家合资企业，生产军用卫星。【原文：Rheinmetall has agreed with Finland's ICEYE to form a joint venture to make military satellites, part of a drive to repurpose automotive factories to serve the booming defence sector instead.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数降幅超过预期
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量降幅超过预期，表明劳动力市场继续保持良好态势，但关税带来的风险正在增加。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, suggesting the labor market continued to chug along, though risks are mounting from tariffs.】

item.title: 调查发现，尽管计划上调产量，欧佩克四月石油产量仍走低
item.description: 路透社的一项调查显示，尽管原定的增产计划已经生效，但欧佩克 4 月份的石油产量仍有所下降，原因是美国再次试图遏制石油流动，导致委内瑞拉的供应量减少，而伊拉克和利比亚的石油产量降幅较小。【原文：OPEC oil output edged lower in April despite a scheduled output hike taking effect, a Reuters survey found, led by a cut in Venezuelan supply on renewed U.S. attempts to curb the flows and smaller drops in Iraq and Libya.】

item.title: 美联储继续按兵不动，欧洲各国央行仍将宽松政策提上日程
item.description: 欧洲各国央行周四与美国央行形成鲜明对比，纷纷降息或暗示将采取宽松政策，即使美联储隔夜保持稳定，也让投资者猜测其下一步行动。【原文：Europe's central banks stood in stark contrast to their U.S. counterpart on Thursday, cutting interest rates or hinting at policy easing to come, even as the Federal Reserve kept a steady hand overnight and left investors guessing about its next move.】

item.title: 比尔-盖茨将在 2045 年前捐出财产，2,000 亿美元用于全球最贫困人口
item.description: 比尔-盖茨（Bill Gates）周四承诺在未来二十年内捐出几乎全部个人财富，并表示在世界各国政府纷纷削减国际援助之际，世界上最贫穷的人将通过他的基金会获得约 2,000 亿美元。【原文：Bill Gates pledged on Thursday to give away almost his entire personal wealth in the next two decades and said the world's poorest would receive some $200 billion via his foundation at a time when governments worldwide are slashing international aid.】

item.title: 欧盟在企业压力下就合并规则改革征求反馈意见
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构正在征求企业和欧洲人对其拟议的合并规则改革的反馈意见，电信供应商希望这一改革将更加重视创新和投资带来的利益。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are seeking feedback from companies and Europeans on their proposed overhaul of merger rules which telecom providers hope will place more emphasis on benefits from innovation and investment.】

item.title: 欧盟针对美国关税制定 950 亿欧元反制措施
item.description: 如果与华盛顿的谈判未能取消美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）实施的一系列关税，欧盟委员会提议对多达 950 亿欧元的美国进口商品采取反制措施。【原文：The European Commission proposed countermeasures on up to 95 billion euros of U.S. imports if negotiations with Washington fail to remove the series of tariffs applied by U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 欧盟可能对美国采取关税反措施的新清单有哪些内容？
item.description: 欧盟委员会于本周四就与华盛顿谈判失败后美国可能采取新的对等关税反制措施的产品进行了公开咨询。【原文：The European Commission has opened a public consultation on Thursday on products which could be hit by new counter-measures to U.S. reciprocal tariffs should negotiations with Washington fail.】

item.title: 以色列量子机器公司与爱丽丝和鲍勃合作建立巴黎量子实验室
item.description: 以色列初创公司量子机器（Quantum Machines）周四表示，它将与法国科技初创公司爱丽丝与鲍勃（Alice & Bob）合作，在巴黎建立一个先进的量子计算实验室。【原文：Israeli startup Quantum Machines said on Thursday it would partner with French tech startup Alice & Bob in an advanced quantum computing laboratory in Paris.】

item.title: 加密世界市场质疑美国例外论，比特币开始大放异彩
item.description: 在抛售美国的狂欢中，比特币姗姗来迟。但是，比特币终于夺回了自己的地位，成为被唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战吓到并热衷于抛售美股、国债和美元的投资者的一大选择。【原文：It's late to the sell-USA party. But bitcoin is finally reclaiming its place as a big alternative for investors spooked by President Donald Trump's trade war and keen to dump U.S. stocks, Treasuries and the dollar.】

item.title: CRH 首席执行官称，利率上升将推迟美国住宅市场的复苏
item.description: 美国最大的建材生产商华润集团（CRH）负责人周四表示，由于利率和通胀率可能会在更长时间内保持较高水平，目前低迷的美国住宅建筑市场的复苏将不可避免地需要更长的时间。【原文：A recovery in the currently subdued U.S. residential construction market will inevitably take longer due to interest rates and inflation potentially staying higher for longer, the head of the largest building materials producer in the United States, CRH , said on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国豁免美国部分进口商品关税
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普于 4 月份对美国商品征收 125% 的报复性关税后，中国对部分药品、微芯片和飞机发动机给予了关税豁免。【原文：China has granted tariff exemptions on select pharmaceuticals, microchips and aircraft engines from its 125% retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods imposed after President Donald Trump unleashed his tariffs in April.】

item.title: Tinder 母公司 Match 裁员 13%，预计营收高于预期
item.description: Match Group 周四预计第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期，并表示将裁员 13%，以削减成本。【原文：Match Group on Thursday forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates and said it would reduce 13% of its workforce to cut costs, as the Tinder parent plows ahead with its business revamp plan.】

item.title: 默克动物保健公司宣布在堪萨斯州投资 8.95 亿美元
item.description: 默克公司（Merck）旗下的默克动物保健公司（Merck Animal Health）周四表示，将投资 8.95 亿美元扩建位于堪萨斯州德索托（De Soto）的生产设施。【原文：Merck Animal Health, a unit of Merck , said on Thursday it would invest $895 million to expand its manufacturing facility in De Soto, Kansas.】

item.title: 消息人士称中国在卢拉访问前恢复从 5 家被暂停进口的公司进口巴西大豆
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的消息人士和中国海关数据显示，中国作为世界上最大的大豆买家，已经恢复了此前因植物检疫问题而暂停的五家公司的巴西大豆装运。【原文：China, the world's largest soybean buyer, has resumed Brazilian soybean shipments from five firms previously suspended over phytosanitary concerns, according to a source familiar with the matter and Chinese customs data.】

item.title: 康菲石油公布第一季度利润超预期，首席财务官将退休
item.description: 康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）周四公布的第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，并表示首席财务官比尔-布洛克（Bill Bullock）将在这家总部位于得克萨斯州的油气生产商工作 39 年后退休。【原文：ConocoPhillips beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday and said Chief Financial Officer Bill Bullock will retire after 39 years with the Texas-based oil and gas producer.】

item.title: 美国 英国着眼于 "重大贸易协议
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 独家新闻消息人士称，美国因伊朗石油问题对中国炼油厂实施制裁导致运营中断
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士称，美国最近对两家购买伊朗石油的中国小型炼油厂实施了制裁，这给它们接收原油造成了困难，并导致它们以其他名义销售产品，这证明华盛顿加大的压力对德黑兰最大的石油买家造成了干扰。【原文：Recent U.S. sanctions on two small Chinese refiners for buying Iranian oil have created difficulties receiving crude and led them to sell product under other names, sources familiar with the matter said, evidence of the disruption that Washington's stepped-up pressure is inflicting on Tehran's biggest oil buyer.】

item.title: 票房疲软，华纳兄弟发现公司收入不及预期
item.description: 华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros Discovery）周四未能达到第一季度营收预期，原因是其工作室缺乏票房大作，以及消费者继续放弃有线电视转而选择流媒体，导致其传统电视业务疲软。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery missed first-quarter revenue estimates on Thursday, weighed down by a lack of big box office hits from its studio and weakness in its traditional TV business as consumers continued to abandon cable for streaming.】

item.title: 英国央行将利率下调至 4.25%，因其认为关税对经济增长造成冲击
item.description: 伦敦，5月8日（路透社）--英国央行周四将其主要利率下调0.25个百分点至4.25%，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税对全球经济增长造成了压力，但政策制定者之间出人意料地出现了三方分歧。【原文：LONDON, May 8 (Reuters) - The Bank of England cut its main interest rate by 0.25 percentage points to 4.25% on Thursday, despite an unexpected three-way split among policymakers as U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs weigh on global economic growth.】

item.title: Kenvue第一季度业绩超出预期，得益于自助护理部门的强劲表现
item.description: 由于泰诺和苯海拉明等咳嗽感冒药的强劲需求帮助抵消了皮肤健康和美容产品需求的下降，Kenvue 周四公布的第一季度利润和收入超出了分析师的预期。【原文：Kenvue beat analysts' expectations for first-quarter profit and revenue on Thursday as strong demand for its cough-and-cold medicines like Tylenol and Benadryl helped offset a fall in demand for its skin health and beauty products.】

item.title: Shopify 第二季度营收高于预期，利润预期拖累股价
item.description: 本周四，Shopify 预计第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期，这表明即使在全球贸易不确定性可能打击零售业务的情况下，这家电子商务公司仍在稳步吸引卖家。【原文：Shopify , forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, signaling the e-commerce company was steadily pulling in sellers even as global trade uncertainty threatens to hit retail businesses.】

item.title: Peloton 提高 2025 年收入预期，指望视频用户增长
item.description: 健身公司 Peloton Interactive 周四上调了 2025 年的营收预期，寄希望于教学视频订阅量的增加来抵消健身器材需求的放缓。【原文：Fitness company Peloton Interactive raised its 2025 revenue forecast on Thursday, banking on an increase in subscriptions for its instructional videos to offset slowing demand for its exercise equipment.】

item.title: Coach 所有者 Tapestry 上调年度销售预期
item.description: 蔻驰母公司 Tapestry 周四第三次上调了 2025 财年的收入预期，主要得益于受特朗普全面关税影响有限，以及广受欢迎的 Tabby 手袋全价销售量增加。【原文：Coach parent Tapestry on Thursday raised its fiscal 2025 revenue forecast for the third time, benefiting from limited exposure to Trump's sweeping tariffs and higher full-price sale of its popular Tabby handbags.】

item.title: 芯片制造商中芯国际第一季度利润大增 161
item.description: 中国最大的合约芯片制造商中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp.【原文：Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp ，China's largest contract chip maker, reported on Thursday a 161.9% year-on-year surge in first-quarter profit.】

item.title: 汉堡王母公司 Restaurant Brands 季度收入不及预期
item.description: 受汉堡王（Burger King）等连锁餐厅需求疲软以及关税相关不确定性的影响，Restaurant Brands 周四未能实现第一季度营收预期。【原文：Restaurant Brands missed first-quarter revenue estimates on Thursday, hurt by weak demand at its restaurant chains such as Burger King against the backdrop of tariff-related uncertainty.】

item.title: 货币反弹，亚洲银行财富管理业务大增
item.description: 银行家和分析师表示，随着客户寻求美元资产的替代品，以及在贸易关税不确定的情况下对冲需求的增长，亚洲货币的大幅反弹必将推动对财富和外汇产品的需求。【原文：A sharp rally in Asian currencies is set to boost demand for wealth and forex products as clients seek alternatives to U.S. dollar-denominated assets and demand for hedging grows amid trade tariff uncertainties, bankers and analysts say.】
